meanings.definition: A black material used for surfacing roads or other outdoor areas.
meanings.sent1: The workers laid down fresh tarmac on the road.
meanings.sent2: The playground was resurfaced with smooth tarmac.
meanings.sent3: The ants had a tarmac picnic on the driveway.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a tarmac, cold and unyielding.
meanings.sent5: Under the scorching sun, the tarmac shimmered like a dark mirror.

meanings.definition: To cover or surface with tarmac.
meanings.sent1: They decided to tarmac the parking lot for better durability.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew will tarmac the runway tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: I tarmacked my driveway, now it looks like a racetrack!
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to tarmac over the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The chef tarmacked the cake with smooth chocolate frosting.
